intro: Calamus digitatus, commonly known as the feathered arrowroot, is a member of the Aroid family (Araceae). It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its tall, slender stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces a spadix surrounded by a colorful spathe, typical of many aroid species. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is often found in wetland or marshy habitats. Calamus digitatus is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
